common_questions: If hired, what would I need to do to make sure you succeed?
if you had worked for the company before, on an application or anything?
explained it was due to medical reasons
explained why he had to leave the first time and they ended up looking into the matter
describe, but this 100% checks out for low end telecom sales
interview_tips: picking up a serving job while you search for something more viable
at least trying to be a server assistant at a fine dining place if you have a reputable one in your area
Sandia, even though it’s in NM (ugh), because if you do well there you’ll eventually be able to get some level of US security clearance
for a interview at Costco? I have no idea what to expect and I am so nervous because it’s been so long since I’ve had an interview
going to the interview just to see how it is
way more effort since this is the first thing someone learns about you
red_flags: asked if you had worked for the company before, on an application or anything?
like the color of your shoelaces
even know how many applications I've sent out over the past two years or so
own a car, I'm semi-reliant on my meds for ADHD and my life with ASD
hear back OR I interview and am not selected for hire
know what's wrong with me or what's making employers not want to hire me
own any dress pants whatsoever, I literally cannot afford them
want to deal with the Applebees/TGIFridays crowd, I'd recommend at least trying to be a server assistant at a fine dining place if you have a reputabl

process_insights.format: Mix of technical, behavioral, on-site, virtual
